intro: Spergularia macrotheca var. macrotheca, commonly known as the broad-leaved sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with a sprawling or ascending stem, and its leaves are usually arranged in a basal rosette. The flowers are borne on short pedicels and are often clustered at the ends of the stems.
